summary:
Every company has a story to tell; one that will captivate, educate, broaden horizons, entertain and leave a lasting impact. But let's not forget - it also has to hit the mark. That's where I come in, as the wordsmith who weaves a tale that connects with the audience.

With more than a decade of experience across multinational Fortune 500 companies (getting old!), I've donned both the individual contributor- and small team leader hat in the field of corporate communications. Whether I'm going solo or leading a pack of specialists, as long as my work contributes to the company's success, I'm all in.

I've been fortunate to delve into a diverse range of projects – internal and external, digital, marketing and change communications. I've crafted comprehensive communication strategies from scratch, streamlined efficiency with communication audits, and launched award-winning programs that have boosted employee and client engagement, increased brand awareness and sales, and facilitated change.

I've put pen to paper and produced a wealth of articles, videos, blogs, press releases and social media posts. I've even introduced new communication channels to organizations. When faced with a challenge, whether low engagement, resistance to change, a lack of trust in leadership or high turnover, I tackle it with data and empathy.

My work has sharpened my negotiating skills with senior executives and challenging stakeholders. I build a strong network and strive to become a trusted partner to leaders in all things communications.

I'm a continuous learner, creative, resourceful and curious – a team player at heart, analytical, practical and adaptable. I love seeing projects come to life and pour my heart into my work. 

When it comes to communications, I don't just talk the talk, I write the write, film the film, and tweet the tweet. Let's create a story worth telling!

If you'd like to know more, don't be shy - drop me a line!

profile_positions.description:
As a Communications Business Partner for People and Culture at Ingka | IKEA, I play a vital role in fostering a positive and inclusive company culture. I work closely with teams across the organization to develop and implement 360-degree communication strategies that align with IKEA's vision and values. I use my communication experience and business acumen to bridge the gap between leaders and co-workers, ensuring that everyone is informed and engaged. 

My work focuses on the co-worker experience area, i.e., health and wellbeing, workforce planning, tools and equipment, and co-worker relations. 

I also serve as the editorial/content lead in Group Communications for People & Culture-related topics, ensuring a balanced coverage, both internal and external.

Ingka Group is IKEA's largest retailer, running 392 IKEA stores across 32 markets and counting.
profile_positions.title: Global Communications Business Partner | People & Culture

profile_positions.description:
As a communication business partner to the Employer Services International (ESI) organization ($9B yearly revenue, 13,000+ international associates) I built and led communications programs (client, external and internal communications) and campaigns related to product development, service delivery and process automation, spanning across AMERICAS, EMEA, and APAC. 

I partnered with C-level leadership and business function leads to find suitable solutions to answer their business needs or advise them on the most relevant communication plans. 

I produced content and defined key messages for a range of channels – magazines, newsletters, web, press releases, decks, social media, and more. A part of my time was dedicated to building communication plans and narratives for prioritized projects and building rapport with a regional network of communicators to make sure global and local communications plans were aligned.

Leading the EMEA COVID-19 communications strategy during the global pandemic gave me considerable experience in crisis communications.
profile_positions.title: Global Communications Business Partner | Product & Service Delivery

profile_positions.description:
I led the global communications function at the Adecco Group IT/Digital organization (1,500+ employees from 60+ countries), managing all change and strategic communication projects.  As a part of the Global IT Strategy & Governance team, I worked directly with Adecco Group's Chief Information Officer (a member of the Adecco Group’s Board of Directors), IT leadership team (C–1), and Corporate Communications team on delivering global projects and initiatives.

My mission was to put together a communications strategy with defined relevant, targeted, and measurable communication deliverables, plans, and messages to engage Adecco IT/Digital employees, clients, and investors and support the company's digital transformation – moving from physical branches to digital solutions. I oversaw and developed content for company-wide channels, including organizational, strategic, and product narratives, keynotes, press releases, articles, and presentations. To the best of my abilities, I tried to distil complex matters into easy-to-understand language. 

I actively sourced, measured, and presented employee feedback, and championed communication principles and best practices for all communication activities. I partnered with senior leaders and business stakeholders on how to best approach communications and provided them with know-how and toolkits to communicate effectively.
profile_positions.title: Global Communications Business Partner | IT & Digital Transformation

profile_positions.description:
As the internal communications manager for Siemens Czech Republic – including head office, eight factories, a shared service center, and several smaller facilities (13,000+ employees in total)–, I led the country's internal communication and related employee engagement efforts. Together with a small team (two reports), I worked closely with factory- and unit communication business partners and contributors outside the team (+/- 30 colleagues) on bringing Siemens' internal communications approach to life.

My role was to drive awareness and understanding and to connect employees with the organization’s mission. I oversaw content creation for our communication channels, ensuring internal messages are consistent across all platforms. I established short- and long-term plans, led global projects from vision to launch, built key messages for prioritized topics, and ran regular communication and employee engagement surveys. I was also in charge of Siemens’ country health & well-being program.

According to a 2017 employee communications survey, 68% of Siemens' employees were either very- or rather satisfied with the country’s internal communications. During my time in the position, 4 of our projects received awards from the Czech Institute of Internal Communication. My team's work had been repeatedly recognized as a country benchmark.
profile_positions.title: Internal Communications Manager

profile_positions.description:
My main goal in this role was to ensure consistent and compelling communications with all Siemens' employees in the Czech Republic. I created communication action plans and toolkits and planned content for all internal channels, which comprised of several newsletters (with an average of 64% readership in 2018), an external employee website updated weekly (avg. of 6,400 monthly unique visitors in 2018), an intranet site with a daily news feature (846 readers per article in 2018), an internal social network (790 active users in 2018), digital screens and poster frames across the country and a mobile app (a 30% reach, including blue-collars). 

I was also editor-in-chief of Siemens' print employee newspaper (95% readership, according to a survey I conducted in 2017). I also developed many internal campaigns and brought to life original concepts to internally promote various topics, such as Industry 4.0, IoT & digitalization, GDPR, EHS (employee health and safety), and numerous HR-related topics. 

I ran all corporate social media accounts (these included Twitter, Facebook, LinkedIn, Instagram, and YouTube), and planned and coordinated the production of content.
profile_positions.title: Internal & Digital Communications Specialist

profile_positions.description:
As a part of the Global Communications team in the IT Services business unit, I created both global and local content for our internal channels, which reached over 3,000 employees in 70+ countries.
 
My main task was to ensure internal messages were communicated to employees in a clear, timely, and compelling way via an appropriate format. I was responsible for planning topics to communicate, and I ensured the highest possible quality of the content. I drafted, edited, and produced communications for newsletters, presentations, documents, articles, digital signage, posters, and videos.
 
I drove several local projects and co-managed various global employee communications initiatives – from launching a revised IT business strategy to building awareness programs and deploying new communication channels, to organizing a yearly leadership conference for 150+ executives.
